messages.subject: Re: Batterers
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 02/09/2002 2:55:44 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Probably, but sometimes it can be subtle. I mean, sometimes when a girl sees her boyfriend
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 02/09/2002 2:55:44 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I am assuming the men that turn out to be batterers exhibit some of those
> tendencies before they become husbands, maybe in a controlling manipulative
> manner. Would that be typical?
>
>

Probably, but sometimes it can be subtle. I mean, sometimes when a girl sees
her boyfriend being jealous it makes her feel more secure and flattered. Or
if he seems to get really angry about little things, you might be able to
write it off to his having a bad day.

Often battering really begins during pregnancy. It seems to set a lot of
batterers off.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
